Pre-Game Insights: Dallas Mavericks (20-15, sixth in the Western Conference) vs. Memphis Grizzlies (23-13, third in the Western Conference)
Dallas comes into the matchup with Memphis after losing four games in a row.
The Grizzlies are 2-2 against Southwest Division teams.
Memphis ranks second in the NBA with 30.5 assists per game led by Desmond Bane averaging 5.2.
The Mavericks are 4-2 against the rest of the division.
Dallas ranks fourth in the Western Conference shooting 37.3% from 3-point range.
The Grizzlies average 14.1 made 3-pointers per game this season, 1.2 more made shots on average than the 12.9 per game the Mavericks give up.
The Mavericks average 13.3 made 3-pointers per game this season, 0.3 fewer makes per game than the Grizzlies allow.
Jaren Jackson Jr. is averaging 22.3 points, 6.2 rebounds and 1.6 blocks for the Grizzlies.
Kyrie Irving is averaging 24.3 points and 4.9 assists for the Mavericks.
Grizzlies: 5-5, averaging 124.8 points, 50.7 rebounds, 30.7 assists, 9.2 steals and 5.4 blocks per game while shooting 46.5% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 118.6 points per game.
Mavericks: 4-6, averaging 112.3 points, 42.2 rebounds, 23.3 assists, 7.7 steals and 7.1 blocks per game while shooting 47.0% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 113.0 points.
Others: Grizzlies Injuries: Luke Kennard: day to day (hamstring), Marcus Smart: out (finger), John Konchar: day to day (shoulder), Santi Aldama: out (ankle), Yuki Kawamura: day to day (shoulder), Vince Williams Jr.: out (ankle), Ja Morant: out (ac joint), GG Jackson II: out (foot).
Mavericks Injuries: Dante Exum: out (wrist), Luka Doncic: out (calf), Kyrie Irving: day to day (illness).
